body:
It would be convenient to be able to load the highest available version of the package. E.g., if I have multiple versions of MPICH installed (for testing against older version), and I don't want to remember or lookup, which is the latest one, to just use it for a project, it would be nice to just say `spack load mpich@MAX`, or something equivalent, and load the latest version.

Alternatively, maybe loading the "preferred version" would be easier, i.e., whatever would get installed if I said `spack install mpich`.

I don't know if this is already possible, and I just can't find how to do, or if it's too minor of a feature to be relevant, but I thought I'd raise it for discussion.
title: Load highest available version
